column4: Hi, im having problem with Lynx boot time, which takes about 5min. I have bootchart generated, although I cant read it much.
use: dmesg | less       look at the timestamps on the left, if yuo see a big gap then thats your issue
Are you sure you respond to me?
yes, thats why I addressed you
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/SQ7LKPPx . Problem located. What does it mean?
If i read the bug comments correctly, nobody knows exactly whats going on. According to bootchart I generated with om26er it takes 300sec for fsck.vfat to fiinish. Is it relevant?
I have 100GB FAT32 partition on /dev/sda4 with legacy data, ubuntu is on ext4 /dev/sda3 16GB . Previously I thought it was caused by fsck checking /dev/sda4 every single time at boot time
yowser bet thats a LOT flakey at best
yowser and flakey? not following you mate
yowser is an exclamation of shock, fat32 really isnt robust and random power offs can garbage data
Lets say its from days of yore. Anyway, I can switch it to ntfs if I really really need to, just not happy about it. Do you think it will help?
Hm, spending 20 minutes installing ubuntu and hours making it at least work feels so... Old school.
lucid is still very young so will have issues. canonical have a rigid release schedule as opposed to debians more flexible approach
so you will get a few issues for a while after release
Well, I will switch to NTFS and we will see..
